com.xceptance.xlt.nocoding.util.context

Class LightWeightContext

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.xceptance.xlt.nocoding.util.context.Context<com.xceptance.xlt.api.htmlunit.LightWeightPage>
      • com.xceptance.xlt.nocoding.util.context.LightWeightContext

  • public class LightWeightContext
extends Context<com.xceptance.xlt.api.htmlunit.LightWeightPage>
    The Context used in the LightWeight mode of the execution. Therefore, it extends Context<LightWeightPage>
    Author:
    ckeiner

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      LightWeightContext(Context<com.xceptance.xlt.api.htmlunit.LightWeightPage> context)
      Creates a new LightWeightContext out of the old LightWeightContext
      LightWeightContext(com.xceptance.xlt.api.util.XltProperties xltProperties)
      Calls LightWeightContext(XltProperties, DataStorage), with a new DataStorage.
      LightWeightContext(com.xceptance.xlt.api.util.XltProperties xltProperties, DataStorage dataStorage)
      Creates a new LightWeightContext, with the provided DataStorage, creates a new XltWebClient and VariableResolver and finally calls Context.initialize().

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void appendToResultBrowser()
      Appends the Context.getPage() to the result browser, if it is not null.
      Otherwise, it creates a new LightWeightPage.
      Context<com.xceptance.xlt.api.htmlunit.LightWeightPage> buildNewContext()
      Creates a new LightWeightContext out of the current one.

      Gets the SgmlPage if it isn't null.
      void loadWebResponse(com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.WebRequest webRequest)
      Loads the WebResponse corresponding to the WebRequest and sets sgmlPage to null.

      • LightWeightContext

        public LightWeightContext(com.xceptance.xlt.api.util.XltProperties xltProperties,
                          DataStorage dataStorage)
        Creates a new LightWeightContext, with the provided DataStorage, creates a new XltWebClient and VariableResolver and finally calls Context.initialize().
        Parameters:
        xltProperties - The properties to use - normally XltProperties.getInstance()
        dataStorage - The DataStorage you want to use
        See Also:
        Context.Context(XltProperties, DataStorage)

      • getSgmlPage

        public com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.SgmlPage getSgmlPage()
        Gets the SgmlPage if it isn't null. Else, it builds the SgmlPage from the WebResponse.
        Returns:

      • loadWebResponse

        public void loadWebResponse(com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.WebRequest webRequest)
                     throws com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.FailingHttpStatusCodeException,
                            java.io.IOException
        Loads the WebResponse corresponding to the WebRequest and sets sgmlPage to null.
        If WebRequest.isXHR() is false, it loads the LightWeightPage and sets the WebResponse.
        If WebRequest.isXHR() is true, it only loads the WebResponse.
        Specified by:
        loadWebResponse in class Context<com.xceptance.xlt.api.htmlunit.LightWeightPage>
        Parameters:
        webRequest - The webRequest that should be send
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.FailingHttpStatusCodeException

      • appendToResultBrowser

        public void appendToResultBrowser()
                           throws com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.FailingHttpStatusCodeException,
                                  java.io.IOException
        Appends the Context.getPage() to the result browser, if it is not null.
        Otherwise, it creates a new LightWeightPage.
        Specified by:
        appendToResultBrowser in class Context<com.xceptance.xlt.api.htmlunit.LightWeightPage>
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.FailingHttpStatusCodeException
